abstract: The bank shed over $16 billion of market value on Monday as its shares fell 20 percent after the downgrade of the United States credit rating.
snippet: The bank shed over $16 billion of market value on Monday as its shares fell 20 percent after the downgrade of the United States credit rating.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America is leading banks back into the mortgage abyss. The nation’s largest financial institution by assets shed over $16 billion of market value on Monday as its shares fell 20 percent after the downgrade of the United States credit rating, and a home loan lawsuit filed by the American International Group, the insurer. Other mortgage-heavy lenders were hit, too, but none as bad as Bank of America.

headline.main: Bank of America Is Back in an Abyss
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Back in an Abyss

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and ROBERT COLE

abstract: With a stock slide still fresh, there are many things to ask the Bank of America chief in a conference call on Wednesday, including: Why are you doing this?
snippet: With a stock slide still fresh, there are many things to ask the Bank of America chief in a conference call on Wednesday, including: Why are you doing this?
lead_paragraph: Bank of America‘s chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan, who has been under fire for his bank’s dismal performance, has agreed to field questions from investors on Wednesday.
